alert.note: Alert for Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:57PM CDT until May 16 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT TUESDAY FOR WRIGHT COUNTY... At 857 PM CDT, The public reported that Newton Road was flood along the Praire Branch due to heavy rainfall from thunderstorms across the warned area early this evening. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mansfield, Hartville, Dawson, Odin, Manes, Grovespring and Graff. This includes the following low water crossings... Elk Creek at Highway Z, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, Gasconade River at Highway E, Whetstone Creek at Owens Road, Baker Creek at Baker Creek Road, Woods Fork Gasconade River at Rippee Ford Road and Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
